required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Trial of Conbercept Intravitreal Injection for Neovascular AMD (PANDA-1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Masked, Randomized, Dose-Ranging Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Conbercept Intravitreal Injection in Subjects With Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration (AMD) (PANDA-1)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of two different levels of conbercept intravitreal (IVT) injection as compared to the approved vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) antagonist active control, aflibercept intravitreal injection (2.0 mg/eye, Eylea®), in subjects with neovascular AMD.

detailed_description.textblock: A multicenter, multinational, double-masked, parallel-group, dose-ranging, active-controlled, randomized trial, which will randomize approximately 1140 subjects in a ratio of 1:1:1 to receive IVT injections of 0.5 mg conbercept, 1.0 mg conbercept, or 2.0 mg aflibercept. The trial includes a screening period of less than or equal to 14 days, followed by a treatment period of 92 weeks (last assessment at 96 weeks) with primary efficacy analysis at 36 weeks.

clinical_study.why_stopped: desired primary endpoint was not met

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) at Week 36 in the study eye
primary_outcome.description: BCVA was assessed by Early Treatment of Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) method

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects maintaining vision (i.e., losing <15 ETDRS BCVA letters) from baseline to Week 36
secondary_outcome.description: To assess proportion of subjects maintaining vision (i.e., losing <15 ETDRS BCVA letters) from baseline to Week 36

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects gaining ≥15 ETDRS BCVA letters from baseline to Week 36
secondary_outcome.description: To assess proportion of subjects gaining ≥15 ETDRS BCVA letters from baseline to Week 36

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in central retinal thickness (µm) by spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT) at Week 36
secondary_outcome.description: To assess mean change from baseline in central retinal thickness (µm) by spectral

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects maintaining vision (i.e. losing <15 ETDRS BCVA letters) from baseline to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: To assess proportion of subjects maintaining vision (i.e. losing <15 ETDRS BCVA letters) from baseline to Week 48

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in ETDRS BCVA letter score at Week 96
secondary_outcome.description: To assess mean change from baseline in ETDRS BCVA letter score at Week 96

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with adverse events as measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the number of participants with adverse events as measure of safety and tolerability

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood concentration of conbercept doses conducted in a subgroup of subjects, when feasible
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the blood concentration of conbercept doses conducted in a subgroup of subjects, when feasible

secondary_outcome.measure: Half-life (t1/2) of conbercept doses conducted in a subgroup of subjects, when feasible
secondary_outcome.description: To assess half-life (t1/2) of conbercept doses conducted in a subgroup of subjects, when feasible

secondary_outcome.measure: Presence of anti-drug antibody of conbercept doses conducted in a subgroup of subjects, when feasible
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the presence of anti-drug antibody of conbercept doses conducted in a subgroup of subjects, when feasible

arm_group.description: Subjects received 0.5 mg conbercept intravitreal injection at Day 1, Week 4 and Week 8 (three injection loading dose), and treated every eight weeks thereafter (0.5 mg, q8w) for a total of 92 weeks treatment in the study eye.

Subjects received 1.0 mg conbercept intravitreal injection at Day 1, Week 4 and Week 8 (three injection loading dose), and treated every twelve weeks thereafter (1.0 mg, q12w) for a total of 92 weeks treatment in the study eye.

Subjects received 2.0 mg aflibercept intravitreal injection at Day 1, Week 4 and Week 8 (three injection loading dose), and treated every eight weeks thereafter (2.0 mg, q8w) for a total of 92 weeks of treatment in the study eye.

intervention.description: Subjects received 0.5 mg conbercept intravitreal injection at Day 1, Week 4 and Week 8 (three injection loading dose), and treated every eight weeks thereafter (0.5 mg, q8w) for a total of 92 weeks treatment in the study eye.

Subjects received 1.0 mg conbercept intravitreal injection at Day 1, Week 4 and Week 8 (three injection loading dose), and treated every twelve weeks thereafter (1.0 mg, q12w) for a total of 92 weeks treatment in the study eye.

Subjects received 2.0 mg aflibercept intravitreal injection at Day 1, Week 4 and Week 8 (three injection loading dose), and treated every eight weeks thereafter (2.0 mg, q8w) for a total of 92 weeks of treatment in the study eye.

facility.name: Kanghong Investigative Site in Hong Kong
